body_content.explanation: the practice of improving standards in one place, area of activity etc. so that they are the same as another place, area of activity etc. where standards were higher:
examples: It leads to a levelling down of standards rather than a levelling up.
He stressed that the lawsuit seeks a levelling up of state aid, and not state aid reductions to wealthy suburban districts.

body_content.explanation: the practice of increasing pay, jobs, living standards, etc. in areas of the country where they are lower than in other areas, so that all areas are more equal:
examples: Many called for more social and regional levelling up.
The government has a very obvious vested interest in levelling up - it needs to keep former Labour voters onside.
